intro: Wikstroemia caudata, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Meliaceae family, which includes mahogany and other tropical hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a rough texture. Wikstroemia caudata typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is adapted to the unique climate of Hawaii.
